description:
Use non-linear least squares to fit a model function `y = f(x, parameters)` to data.

The process throws an `InvalidValues` exception if invalid values are encountered. Invalid values are finite numbers (see also ``is_valid()``).

parameters.name: parameters
parameters.description: Defined the number of parameters for the model function and provides an initial guess for them. At least one parameter is required.

schema.title: Data Cube with optimal values from a previous result of this process.

parameters.name: function
parameters.description:
The model function. It must take the parameters to fit as array through the first argument and the independent variable `x` as the second argument.

It is recommended to store the model function as a user-defined process on the back-end to be able to re-use the model function with the computed optimal values for the parameters afterwards.

parameters.name: x
parameters.description: The value for the independent variable `x`.

parameters.name: parameters
parameters.description: The parameters for the model function, contains at least one parameter.

returns.description: The computed value `y` value for the given independent variable `x` and the parameters.

parameters.name: dimension
parameters.description: The name of the dimension for curve fitting. Must be a dimension with labels that have a order (i.e. numerical labels or a temporal dimension). Fails with a `DimensionNotAvailable` exception if the specified dimension does not exist.

returns.description: A data cube with the optimal values for the parameters.

InvalidValues.message: At least one of the values is not a finite number.

DimensionNotAvailable.message: A dimension with the specified name does not exist.
